intro: Cayaponia trifoliolata, commonly known as the three-leaf cayaponia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and parts of South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cayaponia trifoliolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
